15623658.review:
Go go Chroma Squad!

Now that the game is finally done with its Final Wave of beta-testing, the Super Marvelous Super Sentai inspired RPG is in everyone's hands, and it was well worth the wait.

Only vaguely similar in structure to the also wonderful Knights of Pen & Paper (also developered by Behold Studios), the pixelated adventure takes your through the many misadventured of your own custom made team of  Sentai / Power Rangers inspired actors who have abandoned their previous, terrible acting gig to create their own series.

The director? You, of course!

The game is rife with fan service, and if you have any love for the original Sentai series or the Americanised Power Rangers interpretation of the show, you will feel right at home with this game. A great amount of customistation and developement is under your control, from the genders and colours of your team to the overall look of your costumes.

The main game is a RPG treat, bringing you through numerous seasons and many episodes of your own hilariously awkward show. No trope is left untouched as you battle and "chromatze" your way through hoards of enemy lackies and boss monsters in the well designed turned based RPG gameplay. Though the pixel art may not be to everyone's taste, the humour behind the game's inspiration shines through beautifully.

This is a highly recommended game, and one I encourage every Sentai / Power Rangers to check out. If nothing else, its a better Power Rangers game than any official branded has ever been.

P.S. I make absolutely no apologies for the puns used in this review.

15623594.review:
10/10
This game is amazing. It is different from most games out there, which may bother some people.

You run your own super sentai studio. which involves the management stuff: hire actors, buy/craft equipment, upgrade studio, take care of your fan base, hire marketing agencies. And of course, there is the action: fighting monsters, mecha battles. 

The pros:
- Amazing soundtrack. Really, really, really amazing. You'll feel like a child again watching power rangers, black kamen rider or your favorite super sentai show.
- Beautiful graphics. The very best 2D Pixel Art style.
- Humor everywhere. A lot of hidden references. Pretty cool!
- Great squad customization. You cannot create your own character. You assign actors to squad's roles and you can choose their color, name, skill, equips, weapon. You can also choose the name of the squad, the name of the mecha, the catching phrase.
- Solid combat. Very fun, specially if you follow the director's instructions. 
- Lots of content. This game is huge. You can have 15 hours+ of gameplay. 

The cons:
- Can't stop playing it!

15623569.review:
Enjoying turn based roleplaying? Enjoying squad based character control? Enjoying Sentai?

Get this Game, Now! You don't even need to read further.


A long, long time ago, when I first heard about Chroma Squad, I instantly backed these lovely people at Behold Studios and read every single update they came up with. Seeing this game progress over time was just amazing. Especially to see, how the developers sometimes struggled, but what they have now delivered is really big fun.


You play as a 5 people stunt crew that worked for a very mad producer but decide to quit and create your own show.

The game basically exists from 3 parts:
- Studio management (Buying Props, handling Marketing, dealing with spam mails)
- Episode recording (fights of your squad agains a bunch of enemies, kicking butts)
- Mecha fights (mini game type 1-on-1 fights)

The mechanics of the game seem to be very simple, and I guess they really are. But the gags that have been hidden everywere are just great (I guess, a lot of people might miss a lot, as they are too young).

There is only bad thing I can tell about the game:
@DEVS: Please add that the virtual keyboard pops up, when I play on a Tablet on my train journeys :)

15623352.review:
Chromatize!!!

Oh, this game is going to stay in my mind when I am thinking about round based strategie right after UFO: Enemy Unkown (sorry - its hard to beat that one)

You play as 5 stunt(wo)men who decide to disobey their director and leave to make a hero-show on their own. Each has a specific role ingame that makes one more awesome than the other. 
The plot divides and intertwines between "real-life" and show which leads to funny dialouges between the characters and enemies.

The game itself is NOT a serious simulation and even makes fun of itself. Its mixed with a little bit of income managment and skill editing of the different classes by crafting and/or buying items.
The crafting menu is not complex and not too simple - you get new equipment to buy/craft every "season"(which can be compared to chapters) which require rare materials you can find during an episode(level) or craft/recycle out of lower grade materials.

The gameplay itself can be compared to other RBS - you move your characters a given number of tiles per turn and attack - or use a weapon - or use a skill - or prepare for 'Teamwork' to unleash the super epic ultra finishing move penta deluxe!!!
While gameplay is kept simple the game gives you a number of goals you have to achieve (like: Kill [...] in 2 turns.) in order to gather more audience and get more money and fans for that episode(level) which get harder just like the enemies.

While the enemies are sort of clone troopers its not getting boring since you will encounter a new enemytype or boss almost every level.
The graphics themselves are outstanding (my bar for this one is not set too high) - the looks of the actors are changing with the equipment they are wearing and animations are smooth and flawless. You can see every minute that went into the creation of every art asset in this game.

I'm not quite through with the game but as far as I played I would say that since I saw it on gamescom 2014 it lived up to all my hopes I put in it and didn't waste any of its possible potential. I absolutely fell in love with this game. (Thanks for being with MEGA-BOOTH at gamescom to the devs at this point)

Buy this game if you want a fun ride with awesome ideas/design and changing gameplay.

-RaptorTwitch

15623283.review:
Edit: This review was done with a key obtained from the developer. Somehow, I missed the disclaimer on this originally.

Not since Darkest Dungeon has an experience hit on as many levels as Chroma Squad has. There is a lot of wonderful design decisions made here, and the attention to detail is what shines here: Every detail seems to be thought out from the wonderful Tactical RPG that involves acrobatics and teamwork, to the detail of the story that plays to the strength of the nostalgia of the old Power Rangers. I had this goofy grin on my face the entire time I was playing the game, and this game is an early contender for Indie game of the year. It's that good.

+:
-Team based combat, especially on hard difficulties, rewards thinking and strategy in its teamwork based combat. Acrobatics (the ability to launch people further then they could run by themselves.
-Strong detail payed attention to the details of each episode within the story, to make it feel like a old Power Rangers episode/series. 
-Customization of game takes things to new levels with catchphrases and squad names. Adds a whole level of immersion. 
-Little Details make the experience that much more immersive, such as punishing for using a finishing move that doesn't kill a monster. Audience gauge and Director guidelines help add challenge to make the episode more flashy. 
-Overall, the nostalgia that the game repeatedly hits works on almost every level, from the 8 bit graphics to the references to the series past. In addition, it's able to mix up the modern day media/internet culture into it as well. 
-Studio upgrades leave a lot of different options to play around with. Upgrades, Mech Upgrades, Studio Upgrades, etc.

-:
-Mech battles could be a little bit more challenging.
-Some more information can be provided at times regarding teamwork skills (like the supports healing factor, for example)
-Comes very close to copyright infrigenment in several cases. Worrisome in some cases. 


For Gameplay and First Impressions: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7-5ZEJBXGgY

15623214.review:
Another great game from Behold Studios. It's been a long time coming but retains all of the charm of their earlier Knights of Pen and Paper, plus crunchy tactical RPG combat and all manner of in-jokes and Sentai/Tokusatsu references. Frankly it is a brilliant concept and over the top fun.

Cons: There are bugs and typos. Be careful not to alt tab out as you might not get back in. Sometimes your cursor will loose focus on a pop up menu and you'll be unable to click it, making you force quit. These are rare occurances and will likely be fixed before long. 

Now I have to get back to playing.
